column1: Clone_Commander_stone,"2019-04-28T14:26:10.063Z","Avengers Assemble! An exclusive 10th anniversary set","<h3>Review of&nbsp

column1: The packaging is predominantly black which contrasts from the white packaging of the Endgame sets. To the right of the box is an image of the Iron Man Mark 7 and above is The Avengers (2012) logo to show this set is in

column6: Depending on where you live , it could show you how many pieces are in the&nbsp
column7: set (211). At the bottom is a Marvel Studios logo with &lsquo
column9: underneath. The back of the box shows another image of the set . This set is also a celebration for Avengers Endgame. Avengers Tower&nbsp
column10: is featured in the Avengers Endgame film&nbsp
column11: so makes this set more meaningful and commemorative for the final film in the Infinity Saga.

column2: this set only includes 1 minifigure. Tony Stark , portrayed by Robert Downey JR, therefore seems the most sensible option to include as he owns and pays for the tower and is the main character in the MCU.&nbsp
column3: This Tony Stark minifigure however is different to previous minifigures&nbsp
column4: of the famous hero. In this set Stark is wearing the Iron Man Mark 8
column5: while it is in mid transformation. His right arm and hand are covered by his suit and the chest plate has attached to his torso. This suit configuration is like the scene
column6: in Avengers : Age of Ultron where Vision is born , however&nbsp
column7: that suit was the Mark 43 . The suit included in this set is the Mark 8 which isn&rsquo
column8: t seen in this configuration , but the printing on the torso is accurate to the chest plate on the onscreen Mark 8 having 4 diagonal lines coming from the arc reactor. The printing on the back of the torso is ok however could be more accurate by having a gold accent&nbsp
column9: instead of the white one found on the figure. The head is the same head featured on all of the MCU Iron Man minifigures for the past year . One side of the face has a smirk on and the other has a HUD display which is incredible. An accurate black hairpiece is given to Tony as well&nbsp
column10: as an Iron Man helmet featured on various other Iron Man figures.

column1: The build starts with a black round display table where the figure can be clipped to. The model of the tower then built upon that base. An array of techniques are used to build the Avengers Tower which are effective as it creates the tower&rsquo
column2: s shape quite accurately. The top has a landing pad which comes out quite a bit and the viewing point comes over some of it leaving a slight gap where a quinjet&nbsp
column3: flies out. This is by far the tiniest rendition of the quinjet&nbsp
column4: however accurately captures the crafts shape. On the side of the top of the tower is a printed 2x2 round tile . The tile has an &lsquo
column6: printed on which effectively captures the tower&rsquo
column7: s logo in the films. This piece was created for the Avengers Endgame sets so is effectively re-used here. Two 3x6 w. Angle &rsquo
column8: s are used to create the triangular shape of the tower which is effective. To create the curvature of the back of the tower , 3 Wall 1/2 circle, 2x4x2 W/ Cutout are used.

column1: This set is an amazing promotion with great pieces and an exclusive minifigure. It&rsquo
column2: s clearly not a model to be played with
column3: however is an excellent display model.&nbsp

column1:
,TRUE,5,5,4,3,5 Gridlock007","2019-04-30T19:59:50.963Z","Assemble this set!","

This set is my third favorite GWP (gift with purchase). Set#40334 Avengers Tower is a fulfilling vignette.
Packaging: The packaging was a nice black and red box with the 10 years of Marvel Studios logo in the corner. The instructions have no ad in the back.

Minifigure: The one Minifigure included is a Tony Stark suiting up into Iron Man. While arm and leg printing would have been nice, it looks good as is. He comes with a round translucent blue piece to put his helmet on. He is a good addition to the Hall of Armor set.

Build: The first thing you build is the base. It has a sticking out double headlight piece to put on a Minifigure. SNOT would have been ideal. The build was fun to build, even though it was a bit too repetitive. The Avengers logo is a little off, and the tower is built backwards, but those are not
column2: too hard to modify. The Quinjet included was nice.&nbsp

column1: Comparison to other sets: Lego GWPs are getting better lately. Now, some of the licensed
column3: are Lego Architecture style vignettes. This&nbsp
column4: looks better to me than the minifig scale Age of Ultron&nbsp
column6: s successor, the Battle of Hoth, is worse, though the predecessor, the Diagon Alley, is better.&nbsp

column1: Overall, this is my favorite Marvel promotion they have done. To be eligible for this set,
column2: I recommend you buy the Molten Man Battle, Hydro Man Attack, Avengers Compound Battle, or The Iron Man Hall of Armor, or all!
